alert.note: Alert for Eastern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 16 at 10:40AM PDT until June 18 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 11 PM PDT FRIDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 470... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 470... The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 9 AM to 11 PM PDT Friday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 470 Eastern Elko County. * Winds...Southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts 50 to 65 mph. Strongest winds on Friday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 8 percent. * Impacts...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity may create critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
